title: If Extinction Rebellion cut the dreadlocks, they would get their message to so many more people
text:
There is precious little humour to be found in the “climate emergency”, but it was hard not to smile at a banner spotted in Westminster on Monday which proclaimed: “Extinction Rebellion St Albans”. The last person to say those words was Boudicca, from her chariot, and it didn’t end especially well.

A group of Lib Dem herbivores had clearly travelled up from their blameless Hertfordshire city to lay siege, along with thousands of other protestors, to the evil capital. They had a tough fortnight ahead of them: “dancing their feelings”, pitching tents in the middle of the road outside the Home Office where any parked car would be blown up after 10 minutes, establishing a village under Nelson’s Column....
